item.title: Industrialization & Regulation
item.description: Industrialization & Regulation The wars from the times of Commonization began to die down as the consolidation of power worsened and the entities at war could no longer sustain the constant, escalating conflict.

item.title: Renaissance
item.description: Renaissance Runeographers largely avoided applying Gem energy to organic matter due to the threat of Crystallization, but the control gem families gained through Industrialization & Regulation allowed them to pressure their sponsored runeographers & Inscriptionists into beginning experiments...

item.title: Resilience
item.description: Resilience A measure of matterâ€™s intrinsic resistance to Strain. Dependent on gem-type.

item.title: Commonization
item.description: Commonization Gems have always existed, but the few gems that were discovered were of too powerful a generation to be handled safely.

item.title: Gem Family
item.description: Gem Family A family that owned a powerful early generation Gem which they utilized to gain power.

item.title: Enhancement
item.description: Enhancement A method of utilizing the raw energy from a Gem to strengthen, empower, or energize some form of matter.

item.title: Crystallization
item.description: Crystallization The phenomena of matter being converted into Gems when the incurred Strain exceeds Resilience.

item.title: Gem
item.description: Gem A concentrated collection of energy capable on enhancing or empowering both organic and inorganic matter.

item.title: Gem Generation
item.description: Gem Generation The Gems created through Crystallization are denoted as a subsequent generation. These gems are weaker than the previous generation.

item.title: Runes
item.description: Runes Inscription writing used to direct, manipulate, and regulate the released power of Gems; and they appear most commonly on equipment to safely deliver power to the body or on machines to convert that power into energy while minimizing Strain.
